title: Google - Wikipedia
snippet: Google was founded on September 4, 1998, by American computer scientists Larry Page and Sergey Brin. Together, they own about 14% of its publicly listed shares and control 56% of its stockholder voting power through super-voting stock. The company went public via an initial public offering ...

title: History of Google - Wikipedia
snippet: Google has its origins in "BackRub", a research project started in 1996 by Larry Page and Sergey Brin when they were both PhD students at Stanford University in Stanford, California. The project initially involved an unofficial "third founder", lead programmer Scott Hassan, who left before ...

title: How we started and where we are today - Google - About Google
snippet: Find out where it all began. Read the history of how Google has grown since Larry Page and Sergey Brin founded the company in 1998.

title: Google | History & Facts; Products & Services | Britannica Money
snippet: Google is an American search engine company, founded in 1998 by Sergey Brin and Larry Page. Since 2015, Google has been a subsidiary of the holding company Alphabet, Inc. More than 70% of worldwide online search requests are handled by Google, ...

title: Google Is Founded | Research Starters | EBSCO Research
